noun.description: A soluble gelatinous polysaccharide that is present in ripe fruits and is extracted for use as a setting agent in jams and jellies.
examples: the very early stalks may not have quite enough natural pectin to set properly
two common types of soluble fiber are pectins and gums

origin: Mid 19th century: from Greek pektos congealed (from pēgnuein make solid) + -in.
